title: CARTIER-IA platform: a platform for the management of medical data and imaging
descr:
PyData Salamanca is proud to announce a new meetup!

All the talks will be streamed on our Youtube channel.

Youtube Live link: https://youtu.be/475my9vk6Q8

AGENDA

18:00 pm - Keynote (Spanish)
Title: CARTIER-IA platform: a platform for the management of medical data and imaging.

Abstract:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is growing in popularity due to its support of to complex tasks in different context. Several domains benefit from the application of advanced algorithms and models to their specific problems. One of these domains is the medical sector, where these algorithms can support disease detection, image segmentation and other multiple tasks. However, the intrinsic heterogeneity of medical data makes the application of AI solutions a complex job. In this presentation, we will review the design decisions taken for the implementation of the CARTIER-IA platform: a platform for the management of medical data and imaging with the goal of applying AI algorithms on the unified resources in a straight-forward way.

Speaker: Andrea Vázquez-Ingelmo received the bachelor’s degree in computer engineering from the University of Salamanca, Salamanca, in 2016 and the master’s degree in computer engineering from the same university in 2018. She is a member of the Research Group of Interaction and eLearning (GRIAL), where she is pursuing her PhD degree in computer science. Her area of research is related to human-computer interaction, software engineering, information visualization and machine learning applications.

18:45 pm - Q&A
All questions can be asked using the Youtube live chat.
Questions will be addressed at the end of the keynote.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What is PyData? PyData is a group for users and developers of data analysis tools to share ideas and learn from each other. We gather to discuss best practices, new approaches, and emerging technologies for data management, processing, analytics, and visualization. We approach data science using many languages, including (but not limited to) Python, Julia, and R.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FUTURE SPEAKERS

Would you like to speak at this meetup or a future one? Please submit your proposal at coordinaciondatalabgmailcom

title: La culebrilla que se muerde la cola - Recursividad en Python
descr:
Cuando Python Madrid me preguntó si quería dar una charla, yo propuse hacerla sobre Tail Call Optimization (más bien su ausencia) en Python.

Pero pensé: "mejor explico qué es Tail Call Optimization antes, que si no no se entiende..."

"Ah, pero no puedo explicar qué es Tail Call Optimization sin antes explicar qué son las Tail Calls..."

"Ah! pero entonces, debería explicar..." Y mi cabeza explotó.

"RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded".

En esta charla primero revisitaremos - con condición de parada, ¡lo prometo! - el concepto de recursividad, sus tipos, la guerra "iterativo vs recursivo", cómo Python "guarda" el estado de las funciones en el call stack... para finalmente entender qué es el famoso Tail Call Optimization y por qué nuestro queridísimo Guido no quiso implementarlo en Python.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ponente: Javier Luna. Llevo siendo ingeniero desde que tengo uso de razón, aunque empecé a crear software a los 8 años.
Soy una persona inquieta, curiosa y autodidacta y eso se ve muy reflejado en mi carrera profesional: He sido investigador, desarrollador backend, data engineer, lead teacher en un bootcamp de data science... De tanto soñar despierto he acabado trabajando en la nube, literalmente. Soy SDE en Amazon Web Services en Berlín.

title: Get rid of Matlab! (struggling process from Matlab to Python)
descr:
After a long mental process I decided to switch from Matlab to Python to process my data. First, I had to decide the platform (IDLE, Spyder, Jupyter Notebook) and I chose one, but I changed after some time.

Then, I started by trying to open a txt file and I spend one entire month to do so (I did not know about the libraries). After all, I am glad I took this decision, but there are still many things to learn yet. Pyhton community is lovelly and there is many work already done.

The session would consist on explaining my struggling process and exchange ideas on how to optimize it for someone else.

Speaker: Anna Mujal-Colilles
Level: Beginner
Language: English/Spanish

title: PyBCN Online: May Meetup
descr:
Sam Scott (https://twitter.com/samososos), CTO at oso, an NYC-based startup building an open source policy engine for authorization, will help us understand authorization models in Python applications.

Title:

Adding structure to a sea of chaos: a principled approach to authorization using Python + SQLAlchemy

Abstract:

Authorization is an unstructured problem. Writing code to decide who can do what in your app can cover a broad set of cases. The most structure that typically gets applied to this problem area is a set of if statements and roles, but in reality, there are a lot more patterns and structure that we can apply. oso is an open source system for building authorization into applications. It's a bit like SQLAlchemy in that it provides a structured approached to authorization, much like SQLAlchemy does for data modeling and access. In this talk, we'll provide a mental model for authorization and show how to apply it using oso, Python and SQLAlchemy.

This talk will be in English.

About oso: https://www.osohq.com/
Documentation: https://docs.osohq.com/

----------

The talk will be online in YouTube (THE CURRENT URL IS A PLACEHOLDER THAT WILL BE MODIFIED CLOSER TO THE EVENT DATE)

You will be able to ask written questions during and after the talk in our Slack, in the channel #meetups If you are not a member of our Slack, don't worry, we will send the invite link to all attendees before the talk.

----------

# More
- Our Code of Conduct: https://pybcn.org/coc/

title: Reinterpretación del Gradient Boosting como modelo explicable
descr:
PyData Salamanca is proud to announce a new meetup!

All the talks will be streamed on our Youtube channel.

Youtube Live link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KcbR32xjMw

AGENDA

19:00 pm - Keynote (Spanish)
Title: Reinterpretación del Gradient Boosting como modelo explicable.

Abstract:
En los últimos años ha habido un auge en la aparición de modelos de machine learning que han demostrado dar grandes resultados a nivel predictivo, como por ejemplo el Gradient Boosting (GB). Actualmente, uno de los retos es entender en qué se basan estos modelos para hacer esas predicciones. Nuestro objetivo es, reintepretrar el algoritmo de aprendizaje del GB de modo que, sin modificar sus predicciones ni sus propiedades, la causa de sus predicciones sea entendible por una persona

Speakers:
- Bea Hernández, senior Data Scientist en UrbanDataAnalytics donde desarrolla modelos para el mercado inmobiliario. Fundó de R-Ladies Madrid y habla con gatos. Twitter: @Chucheria
- Ángel Delgado. AI Engineer en Plain Concepts. Estudié Física y lo cuento en twitter @thinbaker

19:45 pm - Q&A
All questions can be asked using the Youtube live chat.
Questions will be addressed at the end of the keynote.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Home and cleaning automation with Microcontrollers and CircuitPython
descr:
For many years, people have been filling their home with devices that are based on Microcontrollers, like virtual assistants, smart fridges, washing machines, security systems, and many others that can be either programmable, or even replicated with a couple of boards and our Python knowledge.

During this activity, we will start exploring CircuitPython without the need of a physical device, using a microcontroller emulator. If you are new to the microcontroller world, don’t worry, we will have an introduction to the main concepts, so we have the base knowledge to start doing little experiments by ourselves.

After the introduction, you will be able to start programming microcontrollers using the emulator, and later you will see a couple of real projects (with real devices!) that could easily be replicated by yourself: a movement-detector, a low-cost robot cleaner, and a plant watering and monitoring system.

Recommended installation before the event:
Step 1: https://github.com/mjmolina/pyladiesBCN_circuitpython_workshop/blob/master/installation.md
Step 2: https://github.com/mjmolina/pyladiesBCN_circuitpython_workshop/blob/master/using_simulator.md

Speaker: Maria Jose Molina
Level: Beginner
Language: English/Spanish

title: Un truco que no conoces de Python: MATLAB
descr:
El verano está a la vuelta de la esquina, y desde Python Madrid hemos organizado el último webinar de la temporada. ¿Te lo vas a perder?

- Webinar
El mundo no es tan simple como para dividirlo entre Pythonist@s y MATLABer@s. Uno de los grandes retos en el desarrollo de software es el de integrar diferentes tecnologías o stack de productos eficientemente, agilizando el desarrollo y facilitando la colaboración entre equipos. En este sentido, MATLAB proporciona una integración flexible y bidireccional con muchos lenguajes de programación, incluido Python. Esto permite que diferentes equipos puedan colaborar, integrando sus desarrollos y llevándolos a producción sin importar su preferencia de lenguaje al programar.

En esta sesión trataremos cómo trabajar conjuntamente con Python y MATLAB, pudiendo llamar indistintamente a algoritmos desarrollados en uno de los dos lenguajes desde el otro, ampliando así las posibilidades a la hora de realizar proyectos en Data Science.

- Ponente
Lucas García, Senior Application Engineer at MathWorks.

title: GeeksCAT :: Data Science :: #03 Lector de matrícules emprant Python
descr:
Deep Learning en una Dashcam emprant Python: Lector de matrícules

Sessió del grup de treball sobre Data Science de l'Associació GeeksCAT (https://geekscat.org) on en Josep Oriol Ayats (https://github.com/joseporiolayats) ens explicarà com aplicar DL sobre una dashcam per fer funcionar un lector de matrícules.

Farem un projecte complert: aconseguirem les dades, el codi, el framework i articularem el procés de crear una xarxa neuronal amb Pytorch per detectar i llegir matrícules.

Live a https://www.twitch.tv/ayatsdev/

title: Integrando Neo4j y Python: un caso basado en datos de contrataciones públicas
descr:
PyData Salamanca is proud to announce a new meetup!

All the talks will be streamed on our Youtube channel.

Youtube Live link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JzPts2mIyP8

AGENDA

19:00 pm - Keynote (Spanish)
Title: Integrando Neo4j y Python: un caso basado en datos de contrataciones públicas.

Abstract:
En los últimos años las bases de datos de grafos han ganado un tremendo impulso debido a su capacidad y flexibilidad para modelar fenómenos en red. En esta sesión Dagoberto y Ricardo nos mostrarán cómo el uso combinado de Neo4j y Python proporciona un poderoso arsenal de herramientas para el análisis de sistemas complejos, como es el caso de una red de contratación pública.

Speakers:
Dagoberto Herrera (profesor de Ciencia de Datos en ULACIT Costa Rica) y Ricardo Araya (estudiante del grado en Inteligencia de Negocios por la misma universidad)

Contest:
Entre los participantes que realicen una reseña pública del evento en Twitter, Facebook, Instagram o LinkedIn usando los hashtags #Python #Neo4j #PyData_SAL_CR estaremos rifando tres cursos de UDEMY en ciencia de datos, inteligencia artificial o programación.

Speaker: Natàlia Padilla
Level: Beginner/Intermediate

venue_name: Canòdrom - Ateneu d'Innovació Digital i Democràtica
title: CODED BIAS, by Shalini Kantayya
descr:
Join us in the last Meetup before the summer break! We'll watch together CODED BIAS, the awesome documentary by Shalini Kantayya, and we'll debate the issues and challenges presented in the film with the people from Algorights, https://algorights.org/.

REGISTRATION
Please register in https://canodrom.decidim.barcelona/assemblies/comunitat/f/1651/meetings/2232

CODED BIAS explores the fallout of MIT Media Lab researcher Joy Buolamwini’s discovery that facial recognition does not see dark-skinned faces accurately, and her journey to push for the first-ever legislation in the U.S. to govern against bias in the algorithms that impact us all.

SYNOPSIS

Modern society sits at the intersection of two crucial questions: What does it mean when artificial intelligence increasingly governs our liberties? And what are the consequences for the people AI is biased against? When MIT Media Lab researcher Joy Buolamwini discovers that many facial recognition technologies do not accurately detect darker-skinned faces or classify the faces of women, she delves into an investigation of widespread bias in algorithms. As it turns out, artificial intelligence is not neutral, and women are leading the charge to ensure our civil rights are protected.

-------------------------------------------------

IMPORTANT

The registration is managed by Canòdrom, so we will NOT open RSVP in Meetup. Please register in https://canodrom.decidim.barcelona/assemblies/comunitat/f/1651/meetings/2232

The event will be securely hosted in an open space.

Code of Conduct

Please keep in mind our Code of Conduct: http://www.pyladies.com/CodeOfConduct/

title: PyData Global 2021 (GLOBAL ONLINE CONFERENCE)
descr:
The PyData Global Online Conference is where users, contributors, and newcomers can share experiences to learn from one another and grow together. PyData provides a virtual forum for the international community of users and developers of data analysis tools to share ideas and learn from each other. The global PyData network promotes discussion of best practices, new approaches, and emerging technologies for data management, processing, analytics, and visualization.

This three-day online event consists of talks, tutorials, and discussions to bring attendees the latest project features along with cutting-edge use cases.

The time span of the conference stretches beyond any single time zone, reflecting the global nature of our community. To accommodate our attendees, each session will be recorded and made available to attendees the following day. Following the Conference, all recordings will be posted to the PyData YouTube channel.

title: GeeksCAT - 1ª Festa OpenSource Girona
descr:
Més informació a https://hacktoberfest.geekscat.org

Registre obligatori a https://www.eventbrite.es/e/entradas-festa-opensource-girona-2021-geekscat-187819452037

## Què farem?

Trobada presencial. Disposarem de sales on s'impartiran diverses xerrades relacionades amb la tech i l'OpenSource.

Paral·lelament, qui vulgui podrà dedicar l'estona a contribuir amb l'OS. Hi haurà mentors que ajudaran a qui ho necessiti.

Tancarem amb una taula rodona; la idea és anar desgranant les diferents dimensions del món FLOSS. Tindrem diversos ponents convidats que analitzaran des de la seva perspectiva les diferents implicacions de l'OpenSource.

Per la tarda i en paral·lel a les xerrades i a la marató tindrà lloc el taller d'introducció a Django on se seguirà parcialment el tutorial de les Django Girls

## Agenda

09:30 - Obertura de portes
10:00 - Kickoff
11:00 - Home Assistant @jbagot
12:00 - Deepf*cking al cloud @joseporiolayats
13:00 - Dinar (lliure)
15:00 - Syncthing @festuc
15:30 - Depurant la gameboy amb r2frida @trufae aka pancake
16:00 - SonicPi @victormartingarcia
17:00 - Com muntar-te la teva pròpia CI/CD OS? @xavitorello
18:00 - Taula Rodona sobre OS
19:00 - Tancament

De 10:00 a 18:00 tindrem habilitada una sala per la marató de PRs. Farem petites xerrades sobre git, github/gitlab, com fer una PR? com cercar issues/projectes als que col·laborar, ...

De 15:00 a 18:00 s'impartirà el taller `"Intro a Django`" (registre obligatori reservant entrada, limitat a 15 assistents). Seguirem parcialment el tutorial de les Django Girls, farem grups petits amb un mentor que ajudarà a l'equip a assolir els reptes del taller. Organitzen els amics de @PyCamp i @argenpython

## Quan ho farem?

El dissabte 23 d'Octubre, al Centre Cultural la Mercè, de Girona.

La jornada començarà a les 10h i acabarem a les 19h.

## Normes de seguretat

Per tal que l’esdeveniment es desenvolupi amb normalitat, caldrà seguir les normes bàsiques de seguretat per al COVID-19:

L'aforament estarà limitat seguint la limitació establerta per l'AdG
Dur mascareta
Mantenir la distància de seguretat de 1.5m
Rentar-se sovint les mans
Utiltizar gel desinfectant
Vetllant per la seguretat no podrem oferir càtering ni res per picar.

Els que vulguem podrem anar plegats a dinar a algun restaurant de la zona.

title: How we built our experimentation framework with Python
descr:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, Preply has been driven by the mission to shape the future of effective learning through human tutoring. The company uses a machine learning algorithm to increase matching efficiency between learners and tutors on a variety of parameters such as price, availability, country of birth, other languages spoken, learning objectives and more. From there, the student can select their preferred tutor considering their introduction video, methodology description and reviews from other learners.

In Preply we have a strong experimentation culture and in this talk we would explain how we created our experimentation framework, step by step and with production code examples. We will show the tools we use, the metrics we check and how our value chain is, from research, design, implementation to measuring. You will learn something that you probably haven’t seen before!

Speaker: Shyamala Gopalakrishnan and Liss Mansurova
Level: Beginner/Intermediate
Language: English

title: PyBCN Online: October Meetup
descr:
PyBCN members David Arcos (https://twitter.com/dzpm), Ruben Berenguel (https://twitter.com/berenguel) and Alberto Cámara ((https://twitter.com/b3r2s)) will explore PyBCN via a technique known as Wardley Mapping. This will help us understand the technique and the many moving pieces this association has.

Title:

Wardley mapping the Python Barcelona Association

Abstract:

Wardley mapping is a visual technique to analyse certain "problem spaces", like businesses, security and others. It is very helpful in providing a share understanding of the problem and also in finding new areas to explore, issues to fix and potential wins. In our case (aside from explaining the technique for everybody!) we want to see what we can learn together about how PyBCN works, how we can make it more efficient and better for all our members.

This talk/round table will be in Catalan.

----------

The talk will be online and hosted in Zoom (THE CURRENT URL IS A PLACEHOLDER THAT WILL BE MODIFIED CLOSER TO THE EVENT DATE)

You will be able to ask written questions during and after the talk in the Zoom event.

----------

title: Python November Meetup (in person!)
descr:
➡️ Talks

1️⃣ Property-based testing with hypothesis
Speaker: Alberto Cámara

Property-based testing is an approach to writing unit tests where, instead of using specific examples, we focus on specifying properties which we expect to hold in all cases. This allows for systematic checks against a multitude of examples and quickly finding errors and edge cases.

We will introduce Hypothesis, a library which allows for property-based testing in a very succint way by integrating with pytest.

Duration: Around 30 minutes
Language: English

2️⃣ Serverless WebApp using GoogleAppEngine
Speakers: Victor Pérez and Carlos Gálvez, from Tiendeo
Duration: Around 30 minutes
Language: Spanish

Cómo hemos usado en Tiendeo la suite de Google Cloud (AppEngine, Datastore, Storage) para el prototipado y despliegue de aplicaciones web y como ha evolucionado el proyecto bcnmarket.barcelona para soportar el incremento de tráfico. Reestructuración del repositorio, mejora de la caché, colas (RabbitMQ), indexado a Elastic, API-Swagger, Celery

➡️ Only register if you can attend!

This is a reduced capacity event. Only register if you plan on attending, and if something comes up please free your spot so somebody else can pick it up!

➡️ Location
Beware, Travelperk has changed offices. Make sure you go to the correct address (the one below, in the event 😜, not the one you remember).

➡️ COVID safe event
- We will ask all attendees to show a vaccination certificate or have a negative covid test taken in the 24 hours previous to the event.
- We will have a reduced attendance ratio.

➡️ Access Control
- The security access control requires an attendee list. Provide your full name in your profile, otherwise you will be REMOVED from the list.
- People under 18 years old only allowed accompanied by one parent or legal guardian.
- There are limited seats, please BE RESPONSIBLE when signing up. If you can't make it, please free up your seat, so someone else can attend. We keep a blacklist with repeated offenders!
